entry.title: Winston Police Arrest 19-Year-Old in Connection With Alleged Drive-By Shooting
entry.summary: A 19-year-old Wilbur man has been arrested following a Winston Police investigation into an alleged drive-by shooting reported in January. Officers executed search warrants, seized a firearm, and lodged the suspect in the Douglas County Jail on multiple charges.

entry.title: Winston Pre-K Students Learn About Food and Creativity During Domino’s Pizza School
entry.summary: Pre-K students from Looking Glass Elementary stepped into the kitchen at Domino’s in Winston on Jan. 28 for a hands-on pizza school. Owner Angelique Martinez taught kids about food, creativity, and how many paths can lead to success.

entry.title: New cashless system for Umpqua Forest recreation sites starts April
entry.summary: Starting April 1, Umpqua National Forest will transition all its developed recreation sites to cashless fee collections.

entry.title: The College Founded by the Inventor of the Service Dog Is Right Here in Douglas County; Puppy Raisers Needed
entry.summary: A college founded by the inventor of the modern service dog is now based in Canyonville. Bergin College of Canine Studies trains service dogs for those in need, including Veterans, and is seeking local volunteers to help raise puppies now entering training.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Charged With First-Degree Arson After Reported Gas Leak at Apartment
entry.summary: A Roseburg man was arrested on arson charges following a January incident involving a reported natural gas leak at an apartment on SE Kane Street. Investigators say fire damage was found near a kitchen range and a gas line had been removed.

entry.title: Police Log: January 30 - February 2, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg Police handled dozens of incidents between Jan. 30 and Feb. 2, including arrests for warrants, DUII, theft, probation violations, prohibited camping, and disorderly conduct. Several citations and custodial bookings were reported across the city.

entry.title: Readers' Choice awards celebrates 25 years
entry.summary: Each year, The News-Review celebrates its annual Readers’ Choice awards. It’s an opportunity for the community to vote on their favorite people, places and establishments located throughout Douglas County, from the Cascades to the Oregon Coast.

entry.title: Douglas County 4-H, Farmers Co-Op to Host Market Goat & Swine Seminar
entry.summary: Douglas County 4-H and Farmers Co-Op will host a free Market Goat and Market Swine Selection & Feed Planning seminar on March 11 at the Douglas County Extension Office. Open to 4-H and FFA youth and families. Registration required.

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAD THE 10TH DRIEST JANUARY ON RECORD
entry.summary: February 1, 2026 9:30 a.m. Roseburg had the 10th driest January on record since data began being recorded in 1899. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said the Roseburg Regional Airport received 1.92 inches of rain during the month. That is approximately only 40 percent of the normal rainfall for the month, which...

entry.title: Peace at Home Announces 15th Annual EMPOWER Dance & Vocal Fundraiser in Douglas County
entry.summary: Peace at Home will host the 15th annual EMPOWER Dance & Vocal Fundraiser on Feb. 28 at Seven Feathers Casino Resort, featuring local performances supporting survivors of domestic and sexual violence. A $25,000 match will apply to paddle raise donations. Tickets and details online.

entry.title: Brew Change for CASA to Raise Funds for Local Children in Douglas County
entry.summary: Brew Change for CASA is set for Feb. 3, 5–8 p.m. at Two Shy Brewing. Half of proceeds from select brews will benefit CASA of Douglas County, supporting local children in foster care. Raffle and volunteers on site.

entry.title: Douglas County chaos: gunfire on I-5 leads to arrest

entry.title: Public events at the observatory to return in spring
